==Japanese==

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|えい|ぞう}}
{{IPAchar|/eizau/}} → {{IPAchar|/eizɔː/}} → {{IPAchar|/eizoː/}}

From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=えいぞう}} compound {{m|zh|影像|tr=ʔjæng<sup>X</sup> zjang<sup>X</sup>|lit=shadow, reflection + image, resemble}}.

Uses the [[漢音#Japanese|kan'on]] reading ''ei'' for the first character, and the [[呉音#Japanese|goon]] reading ''zō'' for the second character. The combined reading is likely a later innovation in Japanese after initial borrowing.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=o|えいぞう|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|えいぞう|hhira=えいざう}}

# a [[portrait]] {{qualifier|as of a person}}
# an [[image]], a [[picture]]

=====Synonyms=====
* {{sense|portrait}} {{ja-r|肖像|しょうぞう}}, {{ja-r|絵姿|えすがた}}, {{ja-r|ポートレート}}

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|よう|ぞう}}
{{IPAchar|/yauzau/}} → {{IPAchar|/yɔːzɔː/}} → {{IPAchar|/yoːzoː/}}

From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=ようぞう}} compound {{m|zh|影像|tr=ʔjæng<sup>X</sup> zjang<sup>X</sup>|lit=shadow, reflection + image, resemble}}.

The [[呉音#Japanese|goon]] reading for both characters, so likely close to the reading as initially borrowed.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=goon|えいぞう|acc=0}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|ようぞう|hhira=やうざう}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=ようぞう|obsolete}} a [[portrait]] {{qualifier|as of a person}}
# {{lb|ja|sort=ようぞう|obsolete}} an [[image]], a [[picture]]

=====Usage notes=====
The ''yōzō'' reading appears to be obsolete in modern Japanese.
